intro: Rodwaya thismiacea, commonly known as the Indian arrowroot. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Araceae, characterized by its underground tubers and showy, spadix-like inflorescences. The plant is native to tropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its tubers are edible and have been traditionally used as a starch source. The species is also noted for its ornamental value due to its unique floral structure.
